solution_line_template: First find the total cost of the asparagus: {asparagus_bundles} bundles * ${asparagus_price_per_bundle}/bundle = $<<{asparagus_bundles}*{asparagus_price_per_bundle}={total_asparagus_cost}>>{total_asparagus_cost}
Then find the total cost of the grapes: {grape_boxes} boxes * ${grape_price_per_box}/bundle = $<<{grape_boxes}*{grape_price_per_box}={total_grape_cost}>>{total_grape_cost}
Then find the total cost of the apples: {num_apples} apples * ${apple_price_per_apple}/apple = $<<{num_apples}*{apple_price_per_apple}={total_apple_cost}>>{total_apple_cost}

Then add the cost of each type of food to find the total cost of the produce: ${total_asparagus_cost} + ${total_grape_cost} + ${total_apple_cost} = $<<{total_asparagus_cost}+{total_grape_cost}+{total_apple_cost}={total_produce_worth}>>{total_produce_worth}
